intro: Tithymalus barrelieri subsp. hercegovinus, commonly known as the Hercegovina tithymalus, is a rare and endemic plant species found in specific regions of the Balkans. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in calcareous soils and is adapted to temperate climates with moderate rainfall. Its flowers are small, white to pale yellow, and attract various pollinators such as bees and flies. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
